botanical_details.potentially_harmful: All parts may cause severe discomfort if ingested. Wear gloves and wash hands after handling
botanical_details.genus: Delphinium can be annuals, biennials or perennials, with palmately lobed basal leaves and showy bowl-shaped flowers in spikes, racemes or panicles

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in a fertile, well-drained soil in full sun; dwarf variety for more exposed locations, no need to stake. Apply a balanced liquid every couple of weeks in the growing season. For best flower spikes thin shoots when 7cm high to leave a minimum of 2-3 shoots on young plants and 5-7 shoots on established plants
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by seed sown at 13°C in early spring
how_to_grow.pruning: Deadhead by cutting spent flower spikes back to small flowering side shoots. Cut down all growth to ground level after it has withered in autumn.
how_to_grow.pests: Prone to slugs, snails, leaf miners and caterpillars
how_to_grow.diseases: May be affected by powdery mildews, crown rot and a virus
